The Rights To Ricky Sanchez: The Sixers Podcast Wed, 02 Oct 2019 09:00:00 +0000 Wed, 02 Oct 2019 09:34:29 +0000 Libsyn WebEngine 2.0 http://spikeeskin.libsyn.com en http://spikeeskin.libsyn.com spike.eskin@gmail.com (spike.eskin@gmail.com) https://ssl-static.libsyn.com/p/assets/c/a/d/6/cad6e433a7252132/New_Logo_Square_iTunes.jpg The Rights To Ricky Sanchez: The Sixers Podcast Spike Eskin 94wip,eagles,eskin,levin,michael,movies,philadelphia,sixers,spike,sports,television,wip clean spike.eskin@gmail.com episodic Sixers Truth And Lies As Training Camp Opens Sixers Truth And Lies As Training Camp Opens Wed, 02 Oct 2019 09:00:00 +0000 The Sixers had their annual media day and opened training camp, and there were a lot of quotes from every player. We go through big quotes from Embiid, Simmons, Horford, Harris, Brown and more and determine whether the person was telling the truth or lying. We also recap Live Ricky IV, the crowning achievement of the Ricky. Basketball has returned, another offseason survived.

Spend New Year's Eve with The Rights To Ricky Sanchez and TJ McConnell! More info here.

Also, Billy King was the Sixers general manager from 1998 until 2007, and then the Nets GM from 2010 until 2016, and a lot happened in those years. Drafting Andre Iguodala, trading Allen Iverson, the famous Celtics trade when he was with the Nets, as well as trading for Deron Williams. We talked to Billy about his time as GM of both teams, the current NBA climate, and Elton Brand’s hiring as Sixers GM, and their chances for an NBA title.

We look back at Burnergate one year later, talk about its lasting effects, every crazy detail we can remember, rank the burner accounts, and go over Colagelo’s Sixers resume. We also go around the league with Ish Smith and discuss the Finals, the Timberwolves front office and the Rockets fire sale. Finally, we end the podcast with a replay of our podcast from one year ago tonight.

]]> It’s been one year since the Ringer published the article about Bryan Colangelo’s burner Twitter accounts that would later get him fired, only to be replaced by Elton Brand, who he once signed and is on the shirt. We look back at Burnergate one year later, talk about its lasting effects, every crazy detail we can remember, rank the burner accounts, and go over Colagelo’s Sixers resume. We also go around the league with Ish Smith and discuss the Finals, the Timberwolves front office and the Rockets fire sale. Finally, we end the podcast with a replay of our podcast from one year ago tonight.

It’s a very sad situation. We talk about the Warriors win and Ben Simmons’ play, the case for Joel Embiid as the league’s MVP, the recent Anthony Davis and Kristaps Porzingis situations and how sad it is that the Celtics aren’t looking so hot, upcoming trade deadline targets, and Andrew Unterberger introduces a controversial theory.

]]> While the Sixers are playing their best basketball of the year and beating the Warriors, the Celtics are falling apart right before our very eyes. It’s a very sad situation. We talk about the Warriors win and Ben Simmons’ play, the case for Joel Embiid as the league’s MVP, the recent Anthony Davis and Kristaps Porzingis situations and how sad it is that the Celtics aren’t looking so hot, upcoming trade deadline targets, and Andrew Unterberger introduces a controversial theory.

]]> The Sixers and the Raptors were in the spotlight of the NBA on Wednesday night, and it was a game for about three quarters. ]]> The Sixers are once again playing basketball. After a summer of questions about jump shots, both Markelle Fultz and Ben Simmons played a game without taking any three pointers, though Fultz did take a couple of 15-footers. We talk about whether we’re encouraged or disappointed by the jumpers, go through Joel Embiid, Dario Saric, and each Sixers player’s performance in the game against Melbourne United. We also take a look back at the context of Elton Brand’s 2008 Philly max and the reactions to it, as well as Brand’s playing career with Andrew Unterberger.

]]> 01:03:16 yes the,ben,michael,spike,simmons,basketball,joel,united,robert,drew,process,levin,trust,melbourne,nba,covington,dario,fultz,sixers,eskin,saric,76ers,embiid,hanlen,markelle The Sixers are once again playing basketball. After a summer of questions about jump shots, both Markelle Fultz and Ben Simmons played a game without taking any three pointers, though Fultz did take a couple of 15-footers. We talk about whether we’re encouraged or disappointed by the jumpers, go through Joel Embiid, Dario Saric, and each Sixers player’s performance in the game against Melbourne United. Go to rightstorickysanchez/weddingvote to read their stories and cast your vote! full Sixers Heat NBA Playoff Preview Sixers Heat NBA Playoff Preview Thu, 12 Apr 2018 07:00:00 +0000 In June, we'll celebrate five years of the Rights To Ricky Sanchez. This is the first podcast we've ever done previewing a playoff series for the Sixers. Let's look at Heat vs. Sixers. We all love the offseason Ricky, but we're glad to wait for it this year.

A side note: the Lottery Party is happening regardless of whether the Sixers are in the Eastern Conference Finals or not. Let's get there first then worry about it!

Ben Simmons Dominates, Markelle Fultz Videos & What Would Sam Do Sat, 06 Jan 2018 16:25:45 +0000 We thought January 2017 might be as good as it gets, but what if January 2018 might be as good as it gets? Saturday (January 6th) at midnight is the DEADLINE to reserve your seat on Bus The Process III. We're going to Chicago, then Milwaukee, to see the Sixers play on ESPN.

]]> We thought January 2017 might be as good as it gets, but what if January 2018 might be as good as it gets? We recap the wins over the Spurs and Stan Van Gundy, dip into the Lorenzo Brown mailbag for a question about Sam Hinkie and Ben Simmons, and discuss the new videos of Markelle Fultz shooting.

Saturday (January 6th) at midnight is the DEADLINE to reserve your seat on Bus The Process III. We're going to Chicago, then Milwaukee, to see the Sixers play on ESPN.

]]> It's a LIVE RICKY. Well they're always recorded live, and you always listen when it's recorded, but this time we were in the same room when it was recorded. Mike calls this a "live Ricky."

The NBA and its coaches decided that the world would rather see Paul Millsap in the All-Star game than Joel Embiid. This is not a world we want to live in. We discuss the Embiid All-Star snub, the TJ McConnell Rising Stars Challenge snub, who we believe the enemies of the Sixers (us) are, this week's games, and take some questions on Facebook Live on the Rights To Ricky Sanchez page.

]]> 01:08:37 no podcast,the,to,michael,spike,basketball,sam,sanchez,process,rights,levin,liberty,noel,trust,ricky,nba,sixers,eskin,nerlens,jahlil,okafor,ballers,hinkie,rtrs Rights To Ricky Sanchez: Ricky Night At The Sixers Wrap-Up, Bad Defense Down The Stretch Malaise Sun, 28 Feb 2016 15:37:28 +0000 Deadspin said we have Stockholm Syndrome, Max Rappaport got like a thousand retweets, we confused other fans and most of the beat writers, and a bunch of Process Trusters refused to chant "Let's Go Sixers" on the big screen, to the confusion of one Christian Crosby. It was a successful RTRS Night at The Center.

We wrap up the evening's highlights, talk about the (probably fake) Dennis Schroeder trade, and try to figure out why the Sixers stink so bad again.

]]> Deadspin said we have Stockholm Syndrome, Max Rappaport got like a thousand retweets, we confused other fans and most of the beat writers, and a bunch of Process Trusters refused to chant "Let's Go Sixers" on the big screen, to the confusion of one Christian Crosby. ]]> One day, we see a crack in our trust in the process.

The next day, we wake up to maybe one of the most one-sided trades we've ever seen.
